body.p: Gas exchange at the respiratory membrane is known as:

feedback.p: Incorrect. Ventilation is the movement of air into and out of our lungs.
Correct. External respiration is the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide at the respiratory membrane.
Incorrect. Internal respiration is the exchange of gas between the tissues and the blood.
Incorrect. Cellular respiration is a process used to convert nutrients to energy.

body.p: In order to convert nutrients to energy the human body requires:

feedback.p: Incorrect. Carbon dioxide is released as a waste product while energy is being produced.
Incorrect. Carbon monoxide is a poison that can inhibit oxygen transport in the blood.
Incorrect. Water will be produced as part of the energy releasing process.
Correct. Oxygen is required to obtain energy from nutrients such as glucose.

body.p: When a bottle of pop is opened you will hear the characteristic hissing that signifies the escaping of carbon dioxide from the liquid into the atmosphere. Which gas law explains why this occurs?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Boyle studied the relationship between the pressure and volume of a gas. He came up with the relationship P1V1= P2V2
Incorrect. Gay Lussac studied how the volumes of gases interacted in chemical reactions and came up with his law of combining volumes.

Correct. Henry’s law states that the solubility of a gas is proportional to the partial pressure of the gas above the liquid. As the can of pop is opened the partial pressure of the atmosphere is lower and some of the dissolved carbon dioxide comes out of the solution.

Incorrect. Charles’ law is based on the observations he made about the relationship between the temperature of gas and the volume of a gas. His law states that the volume of a gas is directly proportional to its temperature.

body.p: If a person is visiting Denver, CO (the mile high city) Why may they need to increase the rate of ventilation until they adapt?

input.choice: The concentration of oxygen is higher at higher altitudes which means it will be harder to move the oxygen into our plasma.
The concentration of oxygen is lower at higher altitudes which means it will be harder to move the oxygen into our plasma.
The partial pressure of oxygen is higher at higher altitudes which means it will be harder to move the oxygen into our plasma.
The partial pressure of oxygen is lower at higher altitudes which means it will be harder to move the oxygen into our plasma.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The concentration of oxygen in Earth’s atmosphere is 21% and this is constant and does not change with altitude.
Incorrect. The concentration of oxygen in Earth’s atmosphere is 21% and this is constant and does not change with altitude.
Incorrect. According to Henry’s law, if the partial pressure of oxygen increased it would be easier to dissolve the oxygen in solution, not harder.

Correct. According to Henry’s law, if the partial pressure of oxygen decreases it will be harder to dissolve the oxygen in solution. This means our body will have to compensate by increasing our rate of respiration.

body.p: During external respiration,the partial pressure of oxygen is higher in the pulmonary arteries is higher than in alveoli.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Oxygen will move from an area of high partial pressure to an area of lower partial pressure. So if the partial pressure was higher in the pulmonary arteries oxygen would would move from the blood to the alveoli.

Correct. Oxygen will move from the higher partial pressure of the alveoli and into the the capillaries that branched off of of the pulmonary arteries. This will allow blood to be transported around the body.

body.p: Which of the following accurately describe external respiration?

input.choice: The partial pressure of oxygen is lower in the pulmonary capillaries because the oxygen from the blood has been used by the body tissues so oxygen will diffuse from the alveoli into the capillaries.
The partial pressure of carbon dioxide is lower in the pulmonary capillaries because the body has created carbon dioxide a waste product so it will diffuse into the alveoli.
The partial pressure of carbon dioxide is higher in the tissues because cells constantly producing it as a waste product so it will diffuse into the capillaries.
The partial pressure of oxygen is lower in the tissues because cells are constantly using it to make energy so oxygen will diffuse from the capillaries into the body tissue.

feedback.p: Correct. In external respiration there is an exchange of oxygen from the alveoli into the capillaries and of carbon dioxide into the alveoli from the capillaries.

Incorrect. The partial of carbon dioxide is higher in the pulmonary capillaries because the cells of the body have created it as a waste product of metabolism. This carbon dioxide will diffuse into the alveoli.
Incorrect. This is a correct description of internal respiration which is the exchange of gasses between the tissues and the blood capillaries.
Incorrect. This is a correct description of internal respiration which is the exchange of gasses between the tissues and the blood capillaries.

body.p: Which component of mucus allows it to maintain local level of hydration?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Immunoglobulins function in the role of protecting the body from pathogens.
Incorrect. Salts play different roles in water balance but are not the primary component of mucus that allows for local hydration.
Correct. Mucins are high molecular weight proteins with glycosylations that attract large amounts of water.
Incorrect. Hemoglobin is a protein found in red blood cells that carries oxygen

body.p: A baby born prematurely may lack surfactant which can result in:

input.choice: A lack of hydration in the respiratory system.
Increased amount of respiratory infections because of a lack of immunoglobulin.
The alveoli may end up collapsing during exhalation.
A decrease in the red blood cells ability to transport oxygen.

feedback.p: Incorrect. A baby lacking mucus will cause a lack of hydration not surfactant.
Incorrect. Immunoglobulins can be found in the mucus and in the blood, it is not a functiof surfactant.
Correct. The function of surfactant is to disrupt the surface tension of the alveoli and prevent them from collapsing.
Incorrect. Hemoglobin is the macromolecule found in red blood cells that carries oxygen not surfactant.

body.p: Which part of hemoglobin is not properly matched with its description?

input.choice: Globin is the protein portion of the hemoglobin that provides structure.
Heme is the planar ring portion of hemoglobin that provides stability.
Iron is the metal portion of hemoglobin that binds to oxygen.
All of the parts of the hemoglobin molecule are correctly matched.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Although the globin part is the protein portion of the hemoglobin it is not the only correctly described portion.
Incorrect. Although heme is the planar ring portion of the hemoglobin, it is not the only correctly described portion.
Incorrect. Although the iron is the metal portion of the hemoglobin it is not the only correctly described portion.
Correct. All three parts of a hemoglobin molecule are correctly matched with their descriptions.

body.p: Oxygen is transport in the blood by:

input.choice: Myoglobin, hemoglobin, dissolved in the plasma
Hemoglobin, red blood cells, white blood cells
Hemoglobin,red blood cells, dissolved in the plasma

feedback.p: Incorrect. Myoglobin stores oxygen in the muscle cells. Oxygen is carried by hemoglobin but that is a protein which is located in red blood cells not white blood cells. White blood cells participate in the immune response and do not transport oxygen.

Incorrect. Myoglobin stores oxygen in the muscle cells. Hemoglobin is a protein found in red blood cells that transports the majority of oxygen to body tissues. Some oxygen is dissolved and transported in the blood plasma.

Incorrect. Even though, hemoglobin is a protein found in red blood cells that transports the majority of oxygen to body tissues. White blood cells participate in the immune response and do not transport oxygen.

Correct. Red blood cells contain high concentrations of hemoglobin which is the protein that transports oxygen to the body’s tissues. Also, Even though oxygen is not very soluble in our blood plasma, a small amount of oxygen is transported in the blood plasma.

body.p: If one heme group dissociates with oxygen it is easier for the other three heme groups in the hemoglobin molecules to dissociate with their oxygen.

feedback.p: Correct. The affinity of oxygen to bind to a heme group changes based on whether oxygen is bound to other heme groups in the molecule.
Incorrect. The affinity of oxygen to bind to a heme group based on whether oxygen is bound to other heme groups in the same molecules. It helps to facilitate loading and unloading of oxygen.

body.p: As lactic acid builds up in the blood it will the pH of the blood and the association of oxygen with hemoglobin.

feedback.p: Incorrect. pH and hydrogen ion concentration have an inverse relationship. Lactic acid will cause an increase in the hydrogen ion concentration because it is an acid, which will lower the pH.
Correct. pH and hydrogen ion concentration have an inverse relationship. As the blood becomes more acidic because of the lactic acid the pH will lower.

Incorrect. As the pH of the blood drops it signals to the body that there is a need for more oxygen. If the affinity between oxygen and hemoglobin was to increase, the oxygen would not be able to diffuse into the cells as readily for use.

Correct. As the pH of the blood falls it signals to the body that there is a need for more oxygen. This will result in a lower affinity between oxygen and hemoglobin so oxygen can diffuse into the body cells for use.

body.p: Which is the most common form mechanism of carbon dioxide transport?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Only about 20-23% of carbon dioxide is carried on the hemoglobin as carbaminohemoglobin.
Incorrect. The major component of blood is water and carbon dioxide will undergo a chemical reaction with the water.
Correct. About 70% of carbon dioxide is transported in our blood as bicarbonate.
Incorrect. Carbonic anhydrase is an enzyme that catalyzes the reaction of water and carbon dioxide.

body.p: Which of the following cell types is not matched properly with its function?

input.choice: Ciliated cells- sweep mucus towards the pharynx.
Basal cells- reproduce to regenerate and maintain epithelial layer.
Type I alveolar cells- Secrete surfactant.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The ciliated cells have cilia on their apical surface that move mucus towards the pharynx to be swallowed.
Incorrect. Goblet cells secrete mucus to help trap microorganisms in the respiratory system.
Incorrect. Basal cells are stem cells that continually reproduce to renew the epithelial cell layer of the respiratory tract.
Correct. Type I alveolar cells are squamous cells that allow for easy diffusion of gases. Type II alveolar cells secrete surfactant.

body.p: Ciliated cells of the bronchial tree function to:

input.choice: Increase the surface area for diffusion

feedback.p: Incorrect. The ciliated cells of the bronchial tree have the mechanical function of beating.
Incorrect. The goblet cells secrete the mucus, the ciliated cells move the mucus.
Correct. The cilia beat to create the mucociliary escalator that moves mucus and the microorganisms trapped in it towards the pharynx.
Incorrect. The diffusion of gas occurs through the squamous cells of the terminal bronchioles and alveoli.
